_values.item: at McMaster University, with solid mathematics and engineering background. Aim to contribute to human knowledge in academia and industry and create a better world by leveraging cutting-edge technologies.

item._value: B.Sc. in Electronic Information Science and Technology
[2021] Successfully Defended My Ph.D. Thesis at McMaster University, Canada
[2020] Ph.D. Comprehensive Examination: Pass with Distinction (P+)
[2017] National Scholarship for Graduate Students at Tsinghua University (¥20000, Rank 1/62)
[2014] National Scholarship for Undergraduate Students at Nankai University (¥8000, Rank 1/46)
[2014] National First Prize in Contemporary Undergraduate Mathematical Contest in Modeling
[2013] Tianjin Province-First Prize in National Undergraduate Electronic Design Contest
[2012] Tianjin Province-First Prize in “TI Cup” Undergraduate Electronic Design Contest
Low-Complexity Layered ACO-OFDM for Power-Efficient Visible Light Communications
L-LACO achieves exactly identical signal as the conventional modulation, LACO-OFDM, however requires fewer than half arithematic operations.
Kramers-Kronig Optical OFDM for Bandlimited Intensity Modulated Visible Light Communications

Different from conventional modulations, we propose a novel Kramers-Kronig (KK) receiver based optical OFDM (KKO-OFDM) that realizes non-negative and bandlimited singal modulationg LED power directly.
Layered Antisymmetry-Constructed Clipped Optical OFDM for Low-Complexity VLC Systems
Compared to conventional LACO-OFDM, we propose LAC-OFDM that constructs antisymmetry in the time domain directly to save half number of arithematic operations.
Absolute Value Layered ACO-OFDM for Intensity-Modulated Optical Wireless Channels
ALACO-OFDM generalizes existing AAO- and LACO-OFDM and achieves higher spectrum and power efficiency even with fewer layers compared to cutting-edge counterparts.
Layered Antisymmetry-Constructed Clipped Optical OFDM for IM/DD Systems
It's a conference-version for LAC-OFDM. We presented this paper at Globecom 2019 in Hawaii, USA. The ICC is one of two IEEE Communications Society's flagship conferences (ICC and Globecom).
Absolute Value Layered ACO-OFDM for Intensity-Modulated Optical Wireless Channels
This is a conference-version of ALACO-OFDM. We gave a presentation at ICC2019 that is one of two IEEE Communications Society's flagship conferences (ICC and Globecom).
MATLAB: 9-year Programming Experience in Simulations, and Algorithm Design and Implementation
Proficient in Simulink, Tool Boxes and APP Related to Communications and DSP (Audio, Image, etc.)
Python: 5-year Programming Experience in Machine Learning Framework Such as TensorFlow and PyTorch
Proficient in Embedded C/C++, Java, Jupyter, JavaScript, Verilog and VHDL (for FPGA)
Experienced with Ubuntu Commands, Git/Github, Android Studio, Google Colab, and IBM Quantum Lab
Proficient in using an Oscilloscope, Spectrum Analyzer, JTAG, Logic Analyzer and Digital Multimeter
Proficient in Using Operating Systems Such as Linux/Ubuntu, Windows and macOS
Proficient in Microsoft Office Tools Such as Word, Excel and PPT
Good Team Player and Team Leader with Strong Communication Skills
